      • getHeaders

        public org.mozilla.javascript.Scriptable getHeaders()
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the HTTP headers, including the first header which will be something like "GET / HTTP/1.1" or "HTTP/1.1 200 OK".
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setHeaders

        public void setHeaders(java.lang.String[] headers)
                throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Set the HTTP headers, including the first header which will be something like "GET / HTTP/1.1" or "HTTP/1.1 200 OK".
        Parameters:
        headers - String array of new headers
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

      • appendHeader

        public void appendHeader(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.String value)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Appends a header to the bottom of the HTTP header block of this message
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the header. Eg: Cookie
        value - the value of the header. Eg: sessionid=12345678
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getHeader

        public java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String key)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the first instance of matching header. Use 'getHeaders' if multi instances of header are required, ie two cookies set with 'Set-Cookie'
        Parameters:
        key - The header key to match. Eg: Cookie
        Returns:
        The first matching header, or an empty string if none are found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • removeHeaders

        public void removeHeaders(java.lang.String key)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes all matching headers from this message
        Parameters:
        key - Name of the headers to remove. Eg: Cookie
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • replaceHeaders

        public void replaceHeaders(java.lang.String key,
                  java.lang.String value)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes all headers matching key, then appends a new header.
        Parameters:
        key - The header to remove and the name of the new header
        value - The value of the new header
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getBody

        public java.lang.String getBody()
                         throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Get the body of the message, which is everything after the headers
        Returns:
        A string representing the message body, decoded as UTF-8
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

      • setBody

        public void setBody(java.lang.String body)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the body of the message, which is everything after the headers and whitespace separator. Any Content-Length header (if present) is automatically updated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage()
                            throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Get the the entire message as a String
        Returns:
        A string representing the entire message, decoded as UTF-8
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

      • getVerb

        public java.lang.String getVerb()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the HTTP request verb used. Eg: GET, POST, HEAD etc. This can only be used on request messages.
        Returns:
        String representation of the verb
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getStatusCode

        public int getStatusCode()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the status code of an HTTP response
        Returns:
        HTTP status code (ie 200, 302, etc) as in integer
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        public void setStatusCode(int statusCode)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the status code of an HTTP response
        Parameters:
        statusCode - The status code you want to set.

        java.lang.Exception

      • dumpToFile

        public void dumpToFile(java.lang.String filePath)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Dump this message's raw bytes to a file. If the file exists, this message is appended.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path to the file to write to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • dumpToFile

        public void dumpToFile(java.lang.String filePath,
              java.lang.String appendString)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Dump this message's raw bytes to a file. If the file exists, this message is appended. The optional appendString argument is available if you want to separate messages in a single file, with a few line breaks for example.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path to the file to write to.
        appendString - A string to appendString to the message as it is written to the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
